questions.text: Out of a total of 2000 patients assessed for HIV, 200 were confirmed positive. A new ELISA screening test was conducted on the same group, identifying 260 positive cases, but only 130 of them actually had the disease. What is the specificity of this test?
Which health program does the DANISH international developmental agency support in India?

A 45-year-old healthy man presents with a history of small streaks of blood in his stools. Given that his father was diagnosed with colon cancer at the age of 56, his family physician recommends a colonoscopy. What level of prevention does this fall under?
A total of 60 patients were diagnosed with COVID-19, out of which 12 cases of deaths were reported. Calculate the case fatality rate.

A study Initiated in 2012 at Delhi University with 5000-6000 individuals aimed to evaluate the role of physical activity and its impact on cardiovascular diseases was to be assessed in 2024. What type of study does this represent?

A patient hailing from Delhi prese”ts with fever, arthralgia, and extensive petechial rash for 3 days. Lab investigations revealed a hemoglobin of 9 g/dL, a white blood cell count of 9000 cells/mm3, a platelet count of 20000 cells/mm3, and a prolonged bleeding time. The clotting time was normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not a food adulteration disease?
The mosquito larvae in the image belong to the species:
Which of the following is the correct arrangement for the levels of Health Care?

options.label: B
options.text: 1. Medical colleges and Hospitals, 2-CHC, 3-subcentre and PHC

options.label: C
options.text: 1 CHC, 2 Subcentre, PHC, 3- Medical colleges and Hospitals

options.label: D
options.text: 1-Subcentre and PHC, 2- CHC, 3-Medical colleges and Hospitals

questions.correct_answer: D. 1-Subcentre and PHC, 2- CHC, 3-Medical colleges and Hospitals

questions.text: In a class of 75 students, 80% received the measles vaccine. After one student contracted measles, 12 more students were infected due to exposure. What is the secondary attack rate?
The mascot depicts Sapna, a local school-going girl who will play a role in spreading awareness within the community. Which National Health Program is associated with this?
What are the benefits of transitioning from Oral Polio Vaccine (OPV) to Inactivated Polio Vaccine (IPV)?

options.label: A
options.text: Less incidence of Vaccine Associated Paralytic Polio

questions.correct_answer: A. Less incidence of Vaccine Associated Paralytic Polio

questions.text: Under the Integrated Disease Surveillance Project (IDSP), sentinel surveillance is conducted for which diseases?
Urban Social Health Activist (USHA) workers are proposed to work for a population of
In a normal distribution, the mean value is 82 and SD is 1.5. Calculate the range of 2 SD. SD-Standard deviation
From the given flowchart, identify: A-the management technique used and B- the critical path.
questions.correct_answer: C. A- Network analysis, B-Machinery installation

questions.text: A 7-year-old child presents to OPD with a painless leg deformity and widening of the wrist. Further investigations show hypocalcemia, increased parathyroid hormone and hypophosphatemia with increased alkaline phosphate. A radiograph of the child's legs is shown below. The most common cause of this deformity is
Which of the following is the best indicator of chronic malnutrition?
Which of the following abnormalities is a child with a single palmer transverse crease and low-set ears most likely to have?
What is the appropriate timing for taking a blood sample to diagnose neonatal hypothyroidism?
Which electrolyte abnormality will lead to cardiac arrhythmia in the case of severe vomiting?

What is the most appropriate diagnosis for a 3-month-old child presenting with cold, cough, and rapid breathing (RR 58/min) but no chest indrawing or danger signs according to IMNCI? RR-Respiratory Rate
A newborn child is having respiratory difficulty. The doctor evaluated and the child was found to have a posterolateral defect as shown in the CT image below. What is the diagnosis?
A child presents with micrognathia and low-set ears. These clinical features are commonly associated with which type of genetic abnormality?

A 3-year-old boy presented for routine follow up of his anthropometric surveillance. He was found to be 90cms tall with a lower segment of 45cm. Which among the following is the most likely diagnosis in this child?
A neonate has bilateral chorioretinitis with intraparenchymal calcifications and hydrocephalus. What is the causative organism?
A child with fused carpal bones comes to your clinic, diagnosed with hand-foot genital syndrome. What is the gene associated with hand-foot syndrome?

A 4-week-old neonate was brought to the hospital with complaints of non-bilious vomiting. During the examination, the physician noted a firm, olive-shaped mass in the upper abdomen, which moved during feeding. What is the likely diagnosis for this child?

A four-year-old child has an upper arm circumference of 105 mm. On giving a trial of therapeutic food, the child accepted the feeds well. There is no edema seen on examination. What will be the diagnosis? SAM- severe acute malnutrition

An unvaccinated child from a migrant worker’s family presents with fever, sore throat, a characteristic red blotchy skin rash, and a Bitot’s spot in the right eye. What would be the appropriate management in this situation?

options.label: A
options.text: Isolate in the institution along with Vitamin A treatment

options.label: B
options.text: Home isolation of the child along with Vitamin A supplementation

options.label: C
options.text: Give MR vaccine, isolate the child and vitamin A treatment

options.label: D
options.text: Only Vitamin A supplement, no action needed for the rash

questions.correct_answer: A. Isolate in the institution along with Vitamin A treatment

questions.text: What is the immediate next step in the management of a 29-week gestation infant with a heart rate of less than 100/min and an oxygen saturation of 80% in the right upper limb?

options.label: B
options.text: Positive pressure ventilation with room air

questions.text: An abdominal X-ray of a baby presenting with abdominal distension and hematochezia reveals air in the bowel wall. What is the greatest risk factor for the development of this condition?
A child with a history of intubation presented to the OPD with shortness of breath while playing, approximately six weeks later. X-ray finding is shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?
cMYC gene mutation is seen in which of the following neoplasms?
Patient underwent cholecystectomy and black pigmented gallstones were noticed. Which of the following is the least likely cause?
A 40-year-old man diagnosed with Huntington’s chorea has a family history of the disease. Which of the following best explains the earlier onset of the disease in successive generations?
Identify the cell marked in the histological image of the cerebellum shown below
A patient tested positive for HBsAg, HBeAg and IgM Anti HBc. What is the status of the condition the patient is affected by?

options.label: C
options.text: HBV infection in the recent past

questions.text: A 55-year-old female presents with complaints of persistent headaches. A CT scan of the head reveals a brain tumour. On histopathology, psammoma bodies are seen. Based on these findings, what is the likely diagnosis?

questions.correct_answer: A. Large amorphous densities in mitochondria

questions.text: In von Willebrand disease, what does vWF primarily bind to aid platelet adhesion?

A 45-year-old lady with a history of long-standing goitre presented with a solitary thyroid nodule. Histopathological examination of the thyroid mass shows nests of polygonal cells and pink eosinophilic extracellular material. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient Is suffering from a rare disease with mitochondrial inheritance. This can be inherited from which of the following members?
Alpha-fetoprotein is a tumor marker used in the diagnosis and monitoring of various conditions. In which of the following conditions is AFP typically raised?

A child is brought to your practice with distinguishable features such as obesity, hypotonia, and short stature. The parents of the child complained that he has an increased appetite with several episodes of binge eating. The child also suffers from developmental delays and intellectual disabilities. Karyotyping reveals microdeletion of the paternal copy of chromosome 15. What is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Ovarian mass with thin layer of endometrium

options.label: B
options.text: Empty uterus with adnexal mass and fluid in pelvis

options.label: C
options.text: Empty uterus and adnexal mass with ground glass appearance

options.label: D
options.text: Trilayer endometrium without an adnexal mass

questions.correct_answer: B. Empty uterus with adnexal mass and fluid in pelvis

A patient underwent a forceps delivery a few hours ago and subsequently developed severe pain at the episiotomy site. Examination reveals vulvar swelling with bluish discoloration, along with hypotension (80/60 mmHg) and tachycardia. Which of the following should not be done?
questions.correct_answer: A. Remove the suture in ward

In developed countries, which kind of screening saved the most lives?

A man underwent vasectomy recently. The surgeon advises the patient to abstain from sexual activity for a certain period after the procedure before confirming the success of the vasectomy. Which of the following is the most appropriate recommendation regarding the duration of abstinence post-vasectomy?

options.label: A
options.text: 3 months and after semen analysis is done

options.label: B
options.text: 1 month and after semen analysis is done

questions.correct_answer: A. 3 months and after semen analysis is done

questions.text: How much time delay should there be between the delivery of the head and delivery of the shoulder in the case of shoulder dystocia?

options.label: D

A postmenopausal woman presents with irregular bleeding. Endometrial biopsy revealed endometrial hyperplasia without atypia. How would you consider treating this patient?
A patient with a history of obstructed labor and cesarean section presents with continuous dribbling of urine through vagina on day 7. What is the diagnosis?

A 26-year-old actor came with complaints of being unable to focus on his work. He worked for a short while in various occupations, before deciding he wanted to be an actor. After attending several auditions, he discovered that he was easily distracted, needed help remembering his lines, and even drifted off during reading. Identify the disorder in the given scenario.

A lady came to the hospital after fighting with her husband. She reports that she is unable to speak. However, all neurological and physical examinations are normal, and she does not seem concerned about her condition. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following symptoms does the term ‘affective flattening’ imply?

A doctor asks a patient about her age, and the patient responds, “You know doctor, I’m from a village, I was married at a very young age of 12 years and my husband was just 5 years older than me. Then I had two kids when I was around 18 or something. Now I am 38, but I look like their older sister”. What is most likely thought disorder displayed by patient?

A 24-year-old male with a previous history of psychiatric disorder has become aggressive with neighbours. He is cheerful, speaking rapidly and also sleeping little. He exhibits hyperactive behaviour after discontinuing his prescribed medication. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A lady presents to the hospital after having a fight with her husband. She reports that she is unable to speak. However, all neurological and physical examinations are normal, and she does not seem concerned about her health status. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient presented with paracetamol poisoning and N-acetylcysteine (NAC) was administered as an antidote. How does NAC prevent toxicity?

options.label: A
options.text: It inhibits the cytochrome P450 enzyme responsible for formation of toxic metabolite

options.label: C
options.text: It neutralizes the free radicals produced by paracetamol

questions.text: A patient with penicillin allergy presents with fever, burning micturition, ototoxicity and dizziness. Which drug is most appropriate for management?
A 35-year-old diabetic man with a BMI of 31kg/m2 presented to the medicine department with concerns of gaining weight. All of the following anti-diabetic drugs can lead to weight gain except?
Which adverse effect of bleomycin can be worsened by radiation therapy?

A diabetic patient came with the complaint of pedal edema due to congestive heart failure and was prescribed a medication that is preferred in the setting of cardiac and renal failure. What is the drug?

A patient of schizophrenia was started on olanzapine therapy a few months ago. It was effective in controlling the symptoms, but the patient stopped taking this drug. What can be the most likely reason?
Resistance to which of the following anti-tubercular drugs occurs due to mutation in katG?

A patient with rheumatoid arthritis was taking Indomethacin for pain. He was started on an ACE inhibitor for hypertension. What is the potential adverse effect that is likely to occur with this combination?
An epileptic patient presents with gum hypertrophy and dizziness. Which anti-epileptic drug is likely the cause?
A 15-year-old girl was brought by her mother to the emergency department 6 hours after ingesting 5 paracetamol tablets. What is most likely progression seen in this case?

options.label: B
options.text: Increase in liver enzymes in the first 24 hours

options.label: D
options.text: N-acetylcysteine should ideally be started after 8 hours of ingestion

questions.correct_answer: B. Increase in liver enzymes in the first 24 hours

questions.text: A male develops tightness In the chest, associated with breathlessness and altered sensorium during his trek towards a mountain peak. The drug prescribed for symptomatic relief acts of which part of the nephron?
A patient with glaucoma is initiated on latanoprost ophthalmic solution 0.005%. Which of the following adverse effects of latanoprost should the patient be informed of?
Which of the following is true about Cisplatin and Carboplatin?

options.label: A
options.text: Carboplatin is more neurotoxic than Cisplatin

options.label: B
options.text: Cisplatin is more nephrotoxic than Carboplatin

options.label: C
options.text: Cisplatin causes more myelosuppression than Carboplatin

options.label: D
options.text: Carboplatin causes more ototoxicity than Cisplatin

questions.correct_answer: B. Cisplatin is more nephrotoxic than Carboplatin

questions.text: A 45-year-old female presents with a mass in the neck. Her T4 levels are high with decreased TSH. She undergoes thyroid ablation therapy using 1-131. What is the most likely adverse effect associated with 1-131 treatment in this patient?
Which of the following platinum based drugs are used in cervical cancer along with radiotherapy?
The risk of cancer that can be reduced with OCP use are all, except? OCP- Oral contraceptive pills
A 28 year female patient is under treatment of antipsychotic drug olanzapine for schizophrenia. She stopped the drug because of which side effect?
Headache patient, temporal region area pain relieved by triptans. diagnosis?

A patient undergoing surgery receives succinylcholine for muscle relaxation and later develops hyperthermia, rigidity, tremors, and tachycardia. What is the most appropriate treatment for this condition?
What is the newly added sixth link in the chain of survival according to the latest AHA update? AHA-American Health Association
A patient scheduled for elective hip surgery in 5 days is taking aspirin, a multivitamin, enalapril, and metoprolol. What is the appropriate perioperative management for this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Stop aspirin to minimize perioperative bleeding risk

options.label: C
options.text: Stop metoprolol to increase cardiac output

options.label: D
options.text: Increase aspirin dosage for additional analgesic benefit

questions.text: A patient in acute hypoxemic respiratory failure is administered oxygen using the device shown below. Name the device.
Soon after the administration of an epidural block with 1.5% lignocaine with epinephrine, your patient went into bradycardia, hypotension, and apnea. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the most likely cause when a patient under general anaesthesia develops left lung collapse after intubation, with breath sounds heard only on the right side during auscultation?

options.label: A
options.text: Mucus secretions obstructing the endotracheal tube

options.label: B
options.text: Pneumothorax on the left side due to PPV

questions.text: A 65-year-old male presents with lower urinary tract symptoms, including weak urinary stream, hesitancy, and nocturia. On digital rectal examination (DRE), a hard, irregular prostate is palpated. He has no significant past medical history but reports mild back pain over the past few weeks. The physician suspects prostate cancer. Which enzyme is elevated in prostate cancer?

A 22-year-old male was brought to the ER after sustaining an astride injury. Following the trauma, he experienced an urge to urinate but was unable to pass urine. On examination, blood was present at the urethral meatus. What is likely to be injured?

A 53-year-old male patient was admitted following a road traffic accident. Paradoxical respiration was seen. His chest X-ray is shown below. He was given analgesics and oxygen was administered via face mask but he developed respiratory failure. What is the best line of management in this case?
Which of the following is the most specific clinical use of Prostate-Specific Antigen (PSA) in the management of prostate cancer?

options.label: A
options.text: Monitoring the response to treatment in prostate cancer patients

options.label: B
options.text: Screening for prostate cancer in all men

options.label: C
options.text: Prognosis and survival of prostrate cancer patient

options.label: D
options.text: Confirming the diagnosis of prostate cancer

questions.correct_answer: A. Monitoring the response to treatment in prostate cancer patients

questions.text: During a splenectomy for a 40-year-old patient with immune thrombocytopenic purpura (ITP), the surgeon must ensure the complete removal of all splenic tissue, including accessory spleens, to prevent symptom recurrence. Accessory spleens are commonly found in specific anatomical locations. Where is the most likely site the surgeon should search for an accessory spleen during the operation?

A 50-year-old male patient underwent an emergency laparotomy for grossly contaminated peritonitis due to a perforated hollow viscus. On postoperative day 7, the patient developed signs of wound infection, including erythema, tenderness, and serosanguinous discharge. Subsequently, the wound showed evidence of dehiscence with exposure of underlying tissues. The patient’s vital signs are stable, with no evidence of ongoing intra-abdominal sepsis. Considering the current wound status, what should be the most appropriate management strategy for the laparotomy wound?

options.label: A
options.text: Vaccum assisted negative pressure wound therapy

options.label: B
options.text: Antibiotic irrigation of the wound followed by delayed primary closure

options.label: C
options.text: Initiating primary wound closure to reduce risk of further contamination

questions.correct_answer: A. Vaccum assisted negative pressure wound therapy

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman presents with a 3cm sub-areolar mass in her left breast. She reports bloody nipple discharge but denies pain, redness or systemic symptoms. On examination, the mass is firm and non-tender. What is the likely diagnosis?
A patient is diagnosed with prostate cancer. What is the mode of spread of prostate cancer to the lumbar vertebra?
A patient presented with abnormally dilated, tortuous veins over the leg, clinically falling into C4a category. Which of the following is the correct treatment in this patient?
Patient after head trauma responds to verbal stimuli with confusion, opens eyes to speech and follows simple commands and is able to localise pain. What is the GCS score?
A patient with grade 4 haemorrhoids underwent surgery. Identify the instruments used during the procedure from the image below.

A 30-year-old patient presented to the casualty with severe upper abdominal pain and vomiting. A nasogastric tube insertion was tried but it was unsuccessful. Chest X-ray showed the following findings. Which of the following episodes of vomiting corresponds to this illness?

options.label: B
options.text: Forceful vomiting against a closed glottis

questions.correct_answer: A. Severe retching with minimal vomitus

questions.text: A young male presents with a painless swelling in the right testis, which he noticed two months ago. On examination, the swelling is firm and non-tender, with no transillumination and the contralateral testis appears normal. An ultrasound reveals a hypoechoic mass in the right testis. Further imaging shows enlargement of the para-aortic and pre-aortic lymph nodes. Tumor markers, including AFP, B-hCG, and LDH, are elevated. The physician suspects testicular cancer. What is the next appropriate step in management?
For infants and children under the age of 2, which of the following samples are the best to diagnose UTI?
questions.correct_answer: B. Suprapubic aspiration and urethral catheterization

questions.text: Identify the imaging modality.

A patient presents with diffuse abdominal pain, and on examination, there is generalised tenderness along with board-like abdominal rigidity. An X-ray of the abdomen is provided. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 28-year-old lactating female presents 2 weeks after delivery, with a 3 cm subareolar mass in her right breast. The mass is associated with redness, tenderness, and mild warmth. She reports no fever but mentions difficulty in breastfeeding from the affected breast. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old male presents with persistent swelling and discomfort over the dorsal aspect of the index finger. He gave a history of penetrative trauma to the area a few days ago. On examination, there is a firm, tender mass with limited mobility of the distal interphalangeal joint. The image is shown below. If left untreated, what is the most likely complication?

options.label: A
options.text: Gangrene of the fingertip due to compromised vascular supply

options.label: B
options.text: Secondary infection requiring removal of the nail bed

options.label: C
options.text: Frog-like deformity of the finger caused by chronic inflammation and tendon dysfunction

options.label: D
options.text: Injury to blood vessels during wound cleaning leading to ischemia

questions.correct_answer: C. Frog-like deformity of the finger caused by chronic inflammation and tendon dysfunction

questions.text: During a laproscopic surgery while inserting a lateral trocar for surgery which of the following is most prone to injury?

options.label: C
options.text: Both superior and inferior epigastric artery

questions.correct_answer: C. Both superior and inferior epigastric artery

questions.text: A 50-year-old diabetic patient presents to you with severe pain and swelling of the left leg. He gives a history of sustaining a thorn prick to his left foot while hiking 5 days ago. The examination of his leg Is given below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient has multiple blood clots in the urine following a TURP procedure. Which catheter should be used for irrigation in this patient?

A 61-year-old hypertensive male patient presents with back pain. He has been smoking for the past 30 years. On physical exam, he has an enlarged pulsatile mass over his abdomen. His CT scan is shown below. Which of the following is an indication for elective surgical repair in this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Presence of a pulsatile mass on physical exam

questions.text: A patient is undergoing breast surgery. Some structures are being retracted during surgery. Identify the arrow-marked muscle in the image.
A 4-year-old-boy was brought to emergency department with complaints of acute radiating pain in right iliac region and during surgery the following structure was found. What is the diagnosis?

A man was brought to the ER after being involved in a fistfight with a bartender, presenting with severe chest pain, dyspnea, distended neck veins, and hypotension (80/50 mmHg). He subsequently collapsed. On examination, percussion revealed hyper resonance in the infraclavicular region with absent breath sounds on the left. A chest X-ray showed a tracheal shift to the right. What is the most likely diagnosis?

On examination, his abdomen is tender in the epigastric region, and there is no palpable mass. Which of the following is the most specific and reliable marker for diagnosing acute pancreatitis?

Identify the part marked ‘A’?

A 30-year-old woman with a painless, rapidly growing, well-defined, mobile breast lump shows a leaf-like pattern with stromal overgrowth on biopsy. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Identify the structure marked in the given image.
An old person presented with an ulcer on the medial canthus with pearly and rolled margins. Histopathology shows nesting cells with peripheral palisading patterns. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 60-year-old female presents with a slow-growing, painless mass in her left breast. On physical examination, the mass is soft, well-circumscribed, and mobile. A biopsy is performed, and histopathology reveals the following. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 2 year old child presents with respiratory distress, cough, unable to speak after eating. What is next step in management?
A carpenter presents with bilateral knee pain and fluctuating swelling in the front of the knee. There is inflammation and tenderness over his knee. MRI of knee is given. What is the diagnosis?

A 20-year-old female patient presented to OPD with the given presentation. On examination, it seems gelatinous in consistency. She reports fluctuation in size, mild numbness in hand and occasional pain. What is the diagnosis?
A 30-year-old man presents to the emergency room following a bike accident. Examination reveals the right upper limb in abduction and external rotation. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: C. Anterior Dislocation of the Shoulder

questions.text: Identify the type of epiphysis.

A 25-year-old man is brought to ER after a car accident. He had multiple injuries and a femoral shaft fracture. He was treated and stabilized. But 48 hours later, he suddenly develops breathing difficulty, increased heart rate and petechial rashes. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A person presents with complaints of clawing of the 4th and 5th fingers. Along with it, there is sensory loss at tips of these fingers. What structure is most likely to be damaged?

A person presents with complaints of numbness, tingling and paresthesias of the thumb, index finger and middle finger. There is numbness at the dorsum of the base of the thumb as well. What structure is most likely to be damaged?
